2061.subject: PSY
2061.descrlong: Social psychology examines how individuals' thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are influenced by other people. This includes how we understand and make sense of other people and how we influence and are influenced by other people. Students develop an understanding of the various theories and methods employed by social psychologists in their attempts to understand social influences on human behavior. Covers aggression and prosocial behavior; prejudice, stereotypes, and discrimination; interpersonal relationships; and persuasion and attitude change.
